alert.note: Alert for Choctaw (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 9:11PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Choctaw and northern Wayne Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 910 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Goodwater, or 13 miles northwest of Waynesboro, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Silas and Gilbertown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for southeastern Mississippi. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for southwestern Alabama.
